intro: Merostachys fimbriolaminata, commonly known as the fringed-leaf grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that have a distinctive fringed or toothed edge, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale green to yellowish flowers. Merostachys fimbriolaminata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions.
